  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      The main() method is ignored if JavaFX application is correctly deployed. This method is only used as a fallback method in the scenario that the javaFX application is unable to be launched through deployment artifacts.
      Parameters:
      args - the command line arguments - unused

    • start

      public void start​(javafx.stage.Stage startGame)
      This methods adds Levels and Screens to the stageController object called, then starts the game. Method starts off by Assigning reference variables to their respective object Reference. After that, the stageController object will call the addScreen function which adds screens to be played and activated. The stage controller then activates the starting Screen for frogger game. JavaFX Screen is then set to be unresizable and attemps to show the window by setting visibiliity to true Lastly, start() method is called.
      Specified by:
      start in class javafx.application.Application
      Parameters:
      startGame - creates a new Instance of Stage

    • createTimer

      public void createTimer()
      Assigns previously declared reference variable "timer" to object Animation Timer.

    • start

      public void start()
      This method creates and starts Animation Timer, causing it to start sending action events to its listeners and plays frogger music.

    • stop

      public void stop()
      This method stops Animation Timer frogger music.
      Overrides:
      stop in class javafx.application.Application
